Description.div:
Stores order line information, including item details and shipping information. To identify the Order to which to add an OrderLine, pass either the OrderHeaderKey, or EnterpriseCode , DocumentType and OrderNo.
The OrderHeaderKey attribute OR the EnterpriseCode, DocumentType and OrderNo attributes must be passed and must be valid.
Line is a bundle parent and child lines are automatically created based on the components of the bundle in the catalog, which contains a model item.

If ApplyOnlyItemLevelPricingRules is passed as Y then pricing rules that are applicable at the item level will be run.
Pricing rules with IsItemRule value as 'Y' are executed.
Passed coupons with IsItemRule value as 'Y' are executed.
Order total pricing rules are suppressed.
Shipping charge calculation, shipping rules execution and shipping coupon execution are suppressed.
Default value is N .

The BOM XML to be used to create the order line and its components.
Both components and BOMXML are passed to create the line.
BOMXML is passed without passing Action as REPLACE_BUNDLE

Describes how product is delivered. DeliveryMethod is only valid for product lines.
Valid Values: DEL - Delivery, SHP -Ship, CARRY - Cash And Carry or PICK - Pickup by the user.
Orderlines having Cash And Carry delivery method are ignored while scheduling the order.
If a DeliveryMethod value is not passed, the value is set as follows:
If the ProductLine has Delivery associations, set to DEL .
If the Item's DefaultDeliveryMethod has a value of Y
in the catalog, then the Item is checked for shipping methods, as defined by the following fields in the Catalog:
Condition
DeliveryMethod value
IS_SHIPPING_ALLLOWED is Y
SHP
IS_DELIVERY_ALLLOWED is Y
DEL
IS_PICKUP_ALLLOWED is Y
PICK
If a value is passed, it must be a valid value.

Indicates how the OrderLines are dependent on the parent line. The DependencyShippingRule can only be specified for the parent line.
If DependencyShippingRule is specified on the parent line, it is defaulted to the same value on all the dependent lines. If DependencyShippingRule is passed on any of the dependent lines, the value passed is ignored.
Default: " " (Null)
Valid values: 01 - Ship together, 02 - Deliver together
If DependencyShippingRule value is 02 , a MergeNode must be specified. Order release created for these lines have a MergeNode value, so shipments are first made to the MergeNode, where they are consolidated for final shipment.
The DependencyShippingRule can only be specified for a product line (ItemGroupCode value is PROD ). A product line associated with a delivery line cannot be a part of any dependency shipping rule.
If DependencyShippingRule is passed for delivery or provided service line or an associated product line.
If MergeNode is not specified for parent line, and DependencyShippingRule value is 02 .
Invalid value is passed.
Based on the DependencyShippingRule, some of attributes on dependent lines are defaulted from the parent line. For these attributes have any value other than what parent line has, the value is ignored.
Value
ShippingRule
ShipNode
ReceivingNode
ShipTo
MergeNode
RequiredShipDate
RequiredDeliveryDate
01 defaults - - - defaults
02 - defaults defaults defaults mandatory

If passed then supplies and demands are read applying the distribution rule filter for inventory availability.
Must be a valid DistributionRuleID for the seller organization passed.

The minimum quantity of the OrderedQty that must be fulfilled in a single release.
Default: 0
Any positive number not greater than line ordered quantity.
If invalid number is passed

Specifies whether the OrderLine is a product, delivery, or provided service Line.
Default: PROD - Product
Valid Values: PROD , DS or PS .
If the ItemGroupCode is not passed, the Item is looked up in the catalog or is assigned during the user exit YCMGetItemDetailsUE. If the Item is not found, the ItemGroupCode is defaulted to PROD .
If the value is passed, it must be a valid value.

Specifies a collection of items that form a unit. For example, a home theater system is a unit, or kit, consisting of components such as a VCR, a TV, a stereo, and other components.
Valid values: LK - Logical kit, PK - Physical kit
If no KitCode is passed, the createOrder API searches the item in the Catalog. The following are the possible scenarios. See Validation Conditions for possible error scenarios.
Kit definition passed
Item in catalog
KitItem
Orderline based on
Y Y Y Passed KitDefinition
N Y Y Catalog definition
Kit definition not passed, item exists in the catalog, it is a kit item, but there is no kit definition.
Kit definition not passed, item does not exist in the catalog.
Kit definition passed as the KitLines element, and the Item is not in catalog.
Kit definition passed as the KitLines element, and the Item is not a KitItem.

If two or more OrderLines are to be delivered together, this is the node where these lines are merged before final delivery. This field is required when the DependencyShippingRule is set to 02 .
Must exist in table YFS_SHIP_NODE.

The preferred minimum ship by date of the available supply that order line can allocate against. Available supply with ship by date earlier than the minimum ship by date will not be considered. This applies to the order line with a valid time-sensitive item. The MinShipByDate of the order line will also be used by all kit lines with valid time-sensitive item.

The quantity of the line item that is being ordered. This quantity is in Inventory UnitOfMeasure. If Quantity needs to be passed in a different UnitOfMeasure (only allowed for a Product line), then it should be passed in OrderLineTranQuantity node.
For a service line item which is used as a standalone service, OrderedQty is treated in the same manner as product lines and must be a non-zero positive number.
The OrderedQty value passed on the service line is ignored, if ordered quantity computaion is not based on entered quantity.
Any non-zero positive number for a product Line or standalone service line.
If not passed for a product Line or standalone service line:

Attribute.Name: Override
Attribute.Description: Flag to Override status modification checks.

Description.div:
The order line number. Part of an OrderLine's unique key. If PrimeLineNo is not passed, it is generated. A starting number can be specified in the configurator at each document type and enterprise level. If a starting number is specified the PrimeLineNo will be generated starting from that number.
Any non-zero positive number.

The date and time when the appointment ends for an OrderLine.
PromisedApptEndDate must be greater than or equal to PromisedApptStartDate.

The date and time when the appointment starts for an OrderLine.
PromisedApptStartDate cannot be after PromisedApptEndDate.

The node to which an OrderLine is to be shipped.
Must exist in table YFS_SHIP_NODE.

Ship node at which this order was created. It is populated only if order was created at a node.
Must exist in table YFS_SHIP_NODE
Determines whether BOM XML specific validations should be skipped. Default: N

TransactionalLineId used to identify a line when creating associations of this line with other lines. This TransactionalLineId is not stored in the database and cannot be used after an order has been created. See ProductServiceAssoc entity for more information.
Must be unique for the createOrder transaction.

Indicates if item needs to be validated against catalog. If passed, the configuration rule for validating the item will be overridden. Must be set to Y to apply entitlement logic.
Default: Null
Valid Values: Y or N

Describes the OrderLine Transaction Quantity in the TransactionalUOM. Should be passed only if OrderedQty has to be passed in a diferent UnitOfMeasure than Inventory UnitOfMeasure and hence is not passed as part of OrderLine element.

Attribute.Name: FillQuantity
Attribute.Description: The minimum order line quantity that must be fulfilled in an order release before it is shipped.

Attribute.Name: OrderedQty
Attribute.Description: The quantity of the the line item that has been ordered. If part of line is cancelled, this number is reduced appropriately. If an order line is returned, this number is not reduced.

Attribute.Name: TransactionalUOM
Attribute.Description: UOM on which all the transactional quantities are specified.

Description.div:
Use this element to derive a new OrderLine from an existing OrderLine.
The existing OrderLine can be identified by using one of the following combinations:
-OrderLineKey
-OrderHeaderKey, PrimeLineNo, and SubLineNo
-OrderNo, EnterpriseCode, DocumentType, PrimeLineNo, and SubLineNo
If the parent line cannot be identified, an error is thrown.
To select only the part of the existing OrderLine associated with a particular release, to derive a new OrderLine from, additional data is needed. In addition to the information to identify the existing OrderLine, supply either the OrderReleaseKey or the ReleaseNo that identifies the release.
Information is taken from the parent line, based on the DerivedOrderDefaultTemplate, stored in the YFS_DOCUMENT_TEMPLATE table. The DerivedOrderDefaultTemplate is chosen on the basis of the DocumentType of the child order.
If there are attributes passed in the createOrder input xml, the values in the passed attributes are used creating the new OrderLine.
Schedule information is never propagated from the parent line to the child line.
The DerivedFromOrderLineKey, DerivedFromOrderHeaderKey and, if applicable, DerivedFromOrderReleaseKey are set on the new OrderLine. The new OrderLineis validated, like all the other lines of the new order.
A transaction is triggered. The transaction is based on the existing order's ProcessType, and the document type of the new order. This IncludeInDerivedOrder transaction changes the status of that quantity of the existing line which is equal to the OrderedQty of the child line. If the parent line does not have sufficient quantity to derive from, error is thrown.

Either the ItemID or a valid AlternateItemID must be passed. If the ItemID is not passed, the catalog will be searched for an item which has the same alias as the AlternateItemID. If an item is still not found in the catalog, the AlternateItemID will be used as the ItemID.

Describes a Special Service or the Options attached to a Delivery or a Provided Service Line. Options can be a Special Service or specified for a Delivery or a Provided Service line.
Same Special Service should not be present multiple times for an order line.
Quantity of Special Service is calculated based on association with PROD item.
An OrderLineOption is passed for a Product OrderLine.

The ItemID of the Item with an Option.
Must be a valid OptionItemID.

Contains information regarding where to ship the OrderLine's information.
If this element is supplied, it overrides the PersonInfoShipTo at the Order level, for this OrderLine.
If this element is not passed, then the ShipTo PersonInfoShipTo is set based on existing data. The following steps are performed in the order listed, and when PersonInfoShipTo is found, it is used for thisOrderLine.
ReceivingNode's address
ReceivingNode's owner's address
Order's PersonInfoShipTo. In this case, the information is not copied to the OrderLine, but is used unless this OrderLines's PersonInfoShipTo is explicitly set.
BillToinformation. If no PersonInfoShipTo is set in the Order, the Bill ToKey is copied to the ShipToKey for the Order.
If passed, at least one attribute must be passed. No other validations are performed.

Free-form text indicating any additional information related to the instruction type. For example, special gift wrapping instructions.
If Instruction is passed, then InstructionText must be passed.

This flag indicates whether price information passed on the line is for information only. If it is 'Y' then line total will not be considered in order total. If it is not passed or passed as 'N' then line total is considered in order total. If this flag is not passed for a static bundle (bundle defined in the catalog), the the flag will be set on the parent and its components based on the BundlePricingStrategy defined on the item.
BundlePricingStrategy Bundle Parent Value Components Value
COMP Y Null (or N)
PARENT Null (or N) Y
ALL Null (or N) Null (or N)
Determines whether all Promotions, except those listed below, should be removed.
Promotions that are associated to an order or any of its lines. PromotionId must be passed to identify the promotion.

Action to perform on this promotion.
Default: Null - if not passed, promotion will be added if it doesn't exist or modified if it does exist.
Valid Values:
CREATE - Add the specified promotion to the order.
REMOVE - Removes the specified promotion from the order.
If an award record is associated with this promotion, it may not be removed.
If a promotion already exists, can't add the same promotion twice.
For Coupon promotions, the overridden maximum adjustment value for the coupon pricing rule.
For Coupon promotions, if 'Y" the references will be validated and only valid references will be used

Name of Reference. The Name can be any text, with no white spaces, within, following or before the text.
Name not supplied when Reference element is supplied.

Element.Description: Contains information for any OrderLine item that is part of a Kit. This occurs when multiple SKUs are grouped to make up one item.

Description.div:
The component item ID.
Must be passed if the KitLine is passed.
The number of components required to create one kit.

Attribute.Name: TransactionalUOM
Attribute.Description: UOM on which all the transactional quantities are specified.

Description.div: Multiple addresses can be associated with an Order and for individual OrderLines. The AdditionalAddress entity is passed through. The system does not have any application logic based on the AdditionalAddress.

Attribute.Name: TransactionalUOM
Attribute.Description: UOM on which all the transactional quantities are specified.

Description.div: This element is present only if the OrderLine depends on another OrderLine.

Both DependentOnPrimeLineNo and DependentOnSubLineNo must be passed for dependent OrderLines.
The DependentOnPrimeLineNo and DependentOnSubLineNo combination passed does not match any other OrderLine.

Both DependentOnPrimeLineNo and DependentOnSubLineNo must be passed for dependent OrderLines.
The DependentOnPrimeLineNo and DependentOnSubLineNo combination passed does not match any other OrderLine.

Specifies the product and service lines being associated. When a new association is created by passing the ProductServiceAssoc, a number of validations are performed.
A delivery or provided service OrderLine can only be associated with a product OrderLine
A delivery OrderLineor a service OrderLine which is not standalone must be associated with a product OrderLine.
One product OrderLine cannot be associated with more than one delivery OrderLine.
The ItemIDs or product line and service line must have an association present.
A stand-alone provided service OrderLine can not associated with any product OrderLine.
If multiple product OrderLines are associated with one delivery OrderLine, there must be consistent information related to delivery. If the delivery line have no values for the following elements and attributes: PersonInfoShipTo, ReqShipDate, ReqDeliveryDate, MergeNode, ReceivingNode, ShipNode
the multiple product OrderLines must not have different values for any of those elements and attributes.
If the delivery multiple product OrderLine has any of these attributes present, the value is copied to all associated product OrderLines, even if different values already exist for the Product multiple product OrderLines.

Primary key generated by the system. May be passed to identify the OrderLine. Alternatively, the PrimeLineNo and the SubLineNo can be passed.
OrderLineKey must identify an existing OrderLine.

The order line number. Must be passed with the SubLineNo to identify the OrderLine. Alternatively, the OrderLineKey can be passed.
Must pass one of the following:
the PrimeLineNo and the SubLineNo
or the OrderLineKey.

Must be passed with the PrimeLineNo to identify the OrderLine. Alternatively, the OrderLineKey can be passed.
Must pass one of the following:
the PrimeLineNo and the SubLineNo
or the OrderLineKey.

Primary key generated by the system.
OrderLineKey must identify an existing OrderLine.

The order line number. Part of an order line's unique key.
Must pass one of the following :
The PrimeLineNo and the SubLineNo or the OrderLineKey.

Part of unique key of line.
Must pass one of the following :
The PrimeLineNo and the SubLineNo or the OrderLineKey.

ProductItem contains the definition of product items involved in a stand-alone service line. This definition is used to calculate the service line quantity and to identify the skills needed to provide the service. These product items will not be fulfilled as part of order fulfillment process.
Product item definition can be given only for a stand-alone provided service OrderLine.
The ItemIDs or product item and service line must have an association present.
Contains information about the child relationships of the order lines.
Contains information about the child order line for the relationship.
Contains information about the parent relationships of the order lines.
Contains information about the parent order line for the relationship.

Identifies a reservation to make for the order line. Existing reservations cannot be modified directly; instead, if a new reservation is created with the same reservation attributes as an existing reservation, the new reservation will be consolidated into the existing reservation, and demand will be created for the new quantity.
If new quantity is being added to the order line in the same call that a reservation is being added, and the reservation matches the order line's attributes, then the reservation will be rolled up in to the order line, and the matching quantity will move to "Reserved" status.

The inventory demand type used by the reservation. For all user-created reservations, this will be defaulted from the document params. When promising server is present and existing inventory reservation is used in order line reservation, pass same DemandType as inventory reservation
The quantity to reserve.

The reservation ID from an existing inventory reservation. If the reservation exists, that quantity will be consumed first. Any quantity that cannot be obtained from the reservation will be reserved on the fly. If ReservationID is not passed, all quantity for this reservation will be reserved on the fly.

Attribute.Name: IsPriceLocked
Attribute.Description: Flag to indicate if the AdditionalLinePrice is Price-Locked. If passed with a value of Y, internal logic will use the passed Price from input for calculation instead of the Price generated by the Pricing Engine.

Description.div:
Operation to perform
Valid Values:
Manage - Creates a new record if it does not exist, or modifies an existing record if it does.
Create - Creates a new record.
Modify - Change values in an existing record.
Delete - Deletes an existing record.
The default behavior is Manage .
Determines whether all Promotions, except those listed below, should be removed.
Promotions that are associated to an order or any of its lines. PromotionId must be passed to identify the promotion.

Action to perform on this promotion.
Default: Null - if not passed, promotion will be added if it doesn't exist or modified if it does exist.
Valid Values:
CREATE - Add the specified promotion to the order.
REMOVE - Removes the specified promotion from the order.
If an award record is associated with this promotion, it may not be removed.
If a promotion already exists, can't add the same promotion twice.
For Coupon promotions, the overridden maximum adjustment value for the coupon pricing rule.
For Coupon promotions, if 'Y" the references will be validated and only valid references will be used

Awards that are created out of the promotions. A single promotion can result in to multiple awards. AwardId must be passed to identify the award.
PromotionId must be passed and it must be a valid one to add the award
Manual Line Charge generated by this Award must not conflict with non-manual Line Charge already on OrderLine

Action to perform on this Award.
Default: Null - if not passed awards will be added if not exist or modified.
Valid Values:
REMOVE - Removes the award.
